feed.title: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository on GitHub

entry.title: [com.charleskorn.kaml:kaml] kaml has potential denial of service while parsing input with anchors and aliases
entry.content:
Impact

Applications that use kaml to parse untrusted input containing anchors and aliases may consume excessive memory and crash.

Patches

Version 0.53.0 and later default to refusing to parse YAML documents containing anchors and aliases.

Workarounds

None.

References

Wikipedia has an explanation of this class of vulnerability: billion laughs attack

Acknowledgements

Thank you to @gdude2002 for reporting this issue.

References

  • https://github.com/charleskorn/kaml/security/advisories/GHSA-c24f-2j3g-rg48
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28118
  • https://github.com/charleskorn/kaml/commit/5f82a2d7e00bfc307afca05d1dc4d7c50593531a
  • https://github.com/charleskorn/kaml/releases/tag/0.53.0
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c24f-2j3g-rg48

entry.title: [com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind] jackson-databind possible Denial of Service if using JDK serialization to serialize JsonNode
entry.content:
jackson-databind 2.10.x through 2.12.x before 2.12.6 and 2.13.x before 2.13.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (2 GB transient heap usage per read) in uncommon situations involving JsonNode JDK serialization.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-46877
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/3328
  • https://groups.google.com/g/jackson-user/c/OsBsirPM_Vw
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/commit/3ccde7d938fea547e598fdefe9a82cff37fed5cb
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson/wiki/Jackson-Release-2.12.6
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson/wiki/Jackson-Release-2.13.1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3x8x-79m2-3w2w

entry.title: [org.apache.sling:org.apache.sling.resourcemerger] Apache Sling Resource Merger has Excessive Iteration vulnerability
entry.content:
Excessive Iteration vulnerability in Apache Software Foundation Apache Sling Resource Merger. This issue affects Apache Sling Resource Merger: from 1.2.0 before 1.4.2.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-26513
  • https://lists.apache.org/thread/xpcpo1y88ldss5hgmvogsf6h3735l5zb
  • https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SLING-11776
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rwrx-x2hw-9h5w

entry.title: [org.apache.dubbo:dubbo] Apache Dubbo vulnerable to Deserialization of Untrusted Data
entry.content:
A deserialization vulnerability existed when dubbo generic invoke, which could lead to malicious code execution. This issue affects Apache Dubbo 2.7.x version 2.7.21 and prior versions; Apache Dubbo 3.0.x version 3.0.13 and prior versions; Apache Dubbo 3.1.x version 3.1.5 and prior versions.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-23638
  • https://lists.apache.org/thread/8h6zscfzj482z512d2v5ft63hdhzm0cb
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-933g-v89r-x8pf

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.main:jenkins-core] Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in Jenkins
entry.content:
Jenkins 2.270 through 2.393 (both inclusive), LTS 2.277.1 through 2.375.3 (both inclusive) does not escape the Jenkins version a plugin depends on when rendering the error message stating its incompatibility with the current version of Jenkins, resulting in a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by attackers able to provide plugins to the configured update sites and have this message shown by Jenkins instances.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-27898
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-03-08/#SECURITY-3037
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j664-qhh4-hpf8

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.main:jenkins-core] Incorrect Authorization in Jenkins Core
entry.content:
Jenkins 2.393 and earlier, LTS 2.375.3 and earlier creates a temporary file in the default temporary directory with the default permissions for newly created files when uploading a plugin for installation, potentially allowing attackers with access to the Jenkins controller file system to read and write the file before it is used, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-27899
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-03-08/#SECURITY-2823
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hf9h-vv4m-2f33

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.main:jenkins-core] Denial of service in Jenkins Core
entry.content:
Jenkins 2.393 and earlier, LTS 2.375.3 and earlier uses the Apache Commons FileUpload library without specifying limits for the number of request parts introduced in version 1.5 for CVE-2023-24998 in hudson.util.MultipartFormDataParser, allowing attackers to trigger a denial of service.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-27900
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-03-08/#SECURITY-3030
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-frgr-c5f2-8qhh

entry.title: [cn.hippo4j:hippo4j-core] Exposure of Sensitive Information in OpenGoofy Hippo4j
entry.content:
Insecure Permissions vulnerability found in OpenGoofy Hippo4j v.1.4.3 allows attacker toescalate privileges via the AddUser method of the UserController function in Tenant Management module.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-27095
  • https://github.com/opengoofy/hippo4j/issues/1061
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xg89-vvwp-9c27

entry.title: [com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind] Uncontrolled Resource Consumption in Jackson-databind
entry.content:
In FasterXML jackson-databind before 2.12.7.1 and in 2.13.x before 2.13.4.1 resource exhaustion can occur because of a lack of a check in primitive value deserializers to avoid deep wrapper array nesting, when the UNWRAP_SINGLE_VALUE_ARRAYS feature is enabled. This was patched in 2.12.7.1, 2.13.4.1, and 2.14.0.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-42003
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/3590
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/commit/d78d00ee7b5245b93103fef3187f70543d67ca33
  • https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=51020
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/blob/2.13/release-notes/VERSION-2.x
  • https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202210-21
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/3627
  • https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/commit/cd090979b7ea78c75e4de8a4aed04f7e9fa8deea
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2022/dsa-5283
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/11/msg00035.html
  • https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20221124-0004/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jjjh-jjxp-wpff

entry.content:
In FasterXML jackson-databind before 2.12.7.1 and in 2.13.x before 2.13.4.1 resource exhaustion can occur because of a lack of a check in primitive value deserializers to avoid deep wrapper array nesting, when the UNWRAP_SINGLE_VALUE_ARRAYS feature is enabled. This was patched in 2.12.7.1, 2.13.4.1, and 2.14.0.

  • https://www.debian.org/security/2022/dsa-5283
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/11/msg00035.html

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.main:jenkins-core] Information disclosure through error stack traces related to agents
entry.content:
Jenkins 2.393 and earlier, LTS 2.375.3 and earlier prints an error stack trace on agent-related pages when agent connections are broken, potentially revealing information about Jenkins configuration that is otherwise inaccessible to attackers.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-27904
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-03-08/#SECURITY-2120
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rrgp-c2w8-6vg6

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.main:jenkins-core] Information disclosure through error stack traces related to agents

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.main:jenkins-core] Incorrect Authorization in Jenkins Core
entry.content:
Jenkins 2.393 and earlier, LTS 2.375.3 and earlier creates a temporary file in the default temporary directory with the default permissions for newly created files when uploading a file parameter through the CLI, potentially allowing attackers with access to the Jenkins controller file system to read and write the file before it is used.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-27903
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-03-08/#SECURITY-3058
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-584m-7r4m-8j6v
